website_summaries.verdict: A playground favorite that won't break the bank. An unbeatable value for the money.
pros: Sturdy and perfectly sized for toddlers to play safely and with confidence
With only two components, assembly couldn't be easier
Half the price of similar models
Robust construction allows for extended use, offering up to six years of sliding fun
cons: Snapping handles into place can be fiddly and require a bit of force to properly secure

customer_reviews.title: Great for a ball pit
customer_reviews.text: Great for a ball pit, just high enough to barely fit over the top rail of this pool. CONS: they say it's foldable, but in order to fold it, you have to take it apart so a bit misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Gates

customer_reviews.title: Great Slide!!!
customer_reviews.text: My baby, who just turned one, was so excited to get this. Soon she saw it she tried to walk up the slide. She soon learned the right way to go, but she still prefers trying to go up the slide first. Its very simple to put together and store. Even my seven year old wanted to try to slide down it. Its a great slide for beginners and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: LJ Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not safe, front lifts off the ground as child climbs the ladder.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our church day care and when a child climbs up the ladder (2 year old), the front of the slide lifts off the ground. The handles at the top of the slide pull out very easily making this a dangerous toy. I am sending the one we bought back and looking for another option. I hate to write negative and am very surprised it has got all this positive feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshinetsb

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy junk
customer_reviews.text: It's a piece of flimsy junk. Like they say, they don't make 'em like they used to. I got this for my 17 month old, and every time he climbs up the steps, the front of the slide lifts off the ground. I worry he's going to topple backwards. There was also a stress mark on the top of the plastic when we first opened it. What else could you possibly be looking for in a slide except for safety? It looks like only a matter of time before this thing topples backwards or sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Bessie

customer_reviews.title: Great gift! Sturdy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this more stars... I would. We purchased this for our 12 month old for Christmas. Highlight of his day! While he doesn't understand the steps.. He enjoys climbing up the red slide and sliding down on his belly!!! This is a pretty sturdy slide as long as you make sure it's on a flat surface. The arms tend to pop up once in a while, so be sure to make check the few interlocking points before allowing a little one to use. As my son cannot use it alone yet, an adult is always with him. I would recommend adult supervision until your child can climb and fall like a pro!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S. Foord

customer_reviews.title: Faulty handles
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this slide. Just arrived today. Hate to give just one star...BUT unfortunately the other reviews are correct - I have tried everything but one of the handles refuses to stay locked in place. It's not safe without it. I'm hoping the seller has a solution! I have to sit on the side and hold in place. Maybe a replacement handle would work. It snaps in place ... then within a few seconds pops back out again. Thought about superglue - but my husband doesn't think it will work ... I don't know, may have to return.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Tipping hazard.  Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: This slide is very easy to assemble however it is made of cheap lightweight plastic and that causes a problem when the child is stepping on the steps to climb up. The slide part lifts off of the ground like it is going to tip backwards each time so I have to sit there and hold it down for fear of it tipping backwards onto my child. The handles are ok but they are very low so that when the child is trying to transition from standing to sitting they have to let go in order to swing their legs though which poses another safety risk. I am returning this slide for the better made Fischer Price one.
customer_reviews.author: kjrogers

customer_reviews.title: Highly Upset
customer_reviews.text: I just knew my daughter and I were going to love this slide for her birthday which is tomorrow (6/22) and her big party is on Saturday. I just knew she'd love this with her friends because it's her favorite thing to play on at the park. However, my heart broke when I unpacked the beat up box to find her birthday present covered in grass with the handles missing. Highly upset and disappointed her surprise is ruined, and there's no listed contact information here. And likely not a quick solution. Furious.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L.

customer_reviews.title: They don’t make them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cheaply made slide. It is not sturdy and part of it broke almost immediately. It was purchased for a two year old. Many years ago my children had a little tikes slide and it was great. Good materials used, sturdy..lasted through four children. So disappointed with this slide.c
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy , thin.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple of months ago in the middle of covid when everyone was buying outdoor things like crazy. My walmart kept selling out of these and I finally found it available on Amazon. This is for my 2 year old. Its not very sturdy, and hes not rough with it at all. There is no rough sharp edges on mine lofe other reviews mentioned. And my slide was easy to put together no issues at all. There is a small dent in the slide which arrived that way. I do not see this lasting long.
customer_reviews.author: kateland howard

customer_reviews.title: Ok, about those handles...
customer_reviews.text: I was wary about this product due to the numerous complaints and bad reviews about the handles popping out. Y’all. Once you get the handles in place, stand up and put some downward pressure on them and then they REALLY fit snugly. I was carrying it around the house using nothing but the handles, no problem. Everyone giving this product a bad review probably just set the handles in until the first little “click” and thought that was it. Nope! Get them set past the first click (which the handles DO pop out of afterward) and THEN stand up and press down on the handles towards the ground! No problems and my 2-yr old loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best $20 spent!
customer_reviews.text: Since this received such high reviews and was only $20 I decided to try this out for my very active 18 month old. We live in a hot climate and going outside isn’t tolerable for very long. This slide keeps him busy and burns energy with his constant up and down movements. We roll balls and toy cars up/down it for added fun. I turn it into a fun hiding spot for him by draping a thin blanket over it too. You won’t regret buying this! It’s also a very affordable present for toddlers that they will love. I’ll add I appreciate the minimal way this is packaged.
customer_reviews.author: LaughingHeart

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come with real instructions. I found a video online that confirmed how simple it should have been to assemble, but the pieces are flimsy and just don’t fit together the way they’re supposed to. Like other reviews have stated, the handles did not stay in place and popped out after a few seconds no matter what I tried. Based on the state of the box, I suspect this is not the first time this particular slide has been returned. Very disappointed in Little Tikes quality these days. Maybe you’ll get lucky and yours will go together fine, but I’d recommend assembling it in advance so you don’t end up with a disappointed kiddo on the big day.
customer_reviews.author: Kringle

customer_reviews.title: Beware of safety issues
customer_reviews.text: I read prior reviews and so I did what was recommended about touching surfaces to make sure it wasn't sharp. I thought I did but I missed a spot. My 18 month old was climbing up and cut her knee with the top part on the stairs where the red part starrs and I covered with tape (will try to upload pictures as of just now I don't see where to upload it!). I would still recommend as once you cover that part it works just fine. I wouldn't recommend to leave child unattended either because while climbing it the bottom part slightly moves upward. So...overall we like it but need to pay attention to safety issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dra.MHC

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The price was awesome, it was super easy to put together. It took maybe 3 minutes to snap together but it’s not very sturdy. I bought it for my first grand child’s play room, she’s 12 months old so it should work fine for her for a while but I doubt it will last through too many future grand kids. This isn’t the sturdy little tikes slide that I remember with my own children. Flimsy is the best description I have for it. I would never try keeping it outside. It would blow around very easily. It probably weighs 5 lbs. But for a young child who likes to climb with supervision inside it should work fine.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Longer Slide than Most
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old daughter LOVES this slide! She told me "thank you Mama!" every morning she saw it for a couple weeks lol. We have it inside in the winter when we couldnt always go play outside. I plan on keeping it inside all the time because she loves it so much. I like how long this slide is. She is tall so I like that she actually gets to slide down it versus smaller slides. I originally bought this one because it folds but I've never folded it since she loves it so much. It is well worth our living room looking like a playground because she enjoys it so much!
customer_reviews.author: Kay H.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who loves slides. She’s always talking about them so I just decided to get it. It’s so sturdy and keeps her distracted for a while, I haven’t had any issues. She’s quite big for her age and it’s still a great size for her. She’s 2, weights 45 pounds and is 3 feet 4 inches. It’s worth every penny and I’m happy my daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.author: kaitlin marie sotero

customer_reviews.title: Sent me a used slide!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the slide and so does my 3 year old son. BUT...the description said it would be coming in its original packaging, which it didn't. All the pieces were just thrown into a big box and there are very visible scratches in multiple places. Also, the parts don't go together quite right. Right now I've got the ladder sort of attached but am unable to push it on all the way. And of course it's stuck there now so I can't even take it apart to start over. One more thing...I can't imagine HOW this would fold up for storage unless you take it apart again, which, like I just said, isn't happening.
customer_reviews.author: April C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, not easy fold
customer_reviews.text: We use this as an indoor slide right in my sons bedroom, within the first night we already got our moneys worth it’s his favorite thing to play with and he never misses a day. It was super easy to put together, I haven’t figured out how it “folds” to be out away but we’re okay with that because of how much it’s used. My son is 30lbs it’s very sturdy, I weigh 105 and I wanted to test it for him. NOTE: the slide doesn’t recommend my weight for the weight limit! However I went and it was fine I felt like it was still sturdy even for me. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids.  Doesn’t “fold” as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy, just make sure everything is firmly snapped into place before use. Handles do take a bit of effort to fully seat. It’s gone through a full summer of abuse in a neighborhood full of toddlers and it still looks like new. As far as the 3 star rating... This thing does not fold, at all, that’s flat out false advertising. You can break it back down with considerable effort, but the slide in no way, shape, or form has the ability to be “folded.” Everything is snapped together and has to be broken down for any kind of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Charles Hintt

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 1 year old grandson. Little Tike is known for its sturdiness- this wasn't the super hard plastic like most of its products- however, it is strong enough for a toddler. We had one problem with it- when you climb up the slide, there is a gap between steps and our little 1 yr old slipped and got caught up by having his foot fall through. So for an unsturdy one year old- I wish I would have gone with a molded step. It is still a great product for the price-and he still loves it-under guidance. The ability to fold it- is a huge plus!
customer_reviews.author: Becky S

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a Christmas gift for our 23 month old son. He loves it! He has been too afraid to try slides at the park so this is a great break-in tool for this spring. He loves to go down himself, and he loves to send all his cars/trucks down as a ramp. It has kept him occupied for long stents, which is impressive for his age. As a parent, I like that it is lightweight (easy to move from room to room) but still sturdy. I can’t speak to whether it’s easy to fold because we haven’t really taken it down yet. But he loves it, we love it, and it is a great price!
customer_reviews.author: TrumpetGeek

customer_reviews.title: My daughter's favorite toy.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter to play with and she completely loves it. Assembly is super simple as you just snap the pieces together. My daughter climbs and slides easily and does really well on the slide for a 15 month old. It is relatively sturdy and we trust our daughter on the slide most of the time. The biggest issue is that storage wise you either need to work the ladder out (which isn't the easiest thing to do) or just deal with the size and find somewhere for it. It is expected to take up space but just keep that in mind if your place is small. Overall we are happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: My Niece Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my niece's 2nd birthday and she is so in love with it! She is continually on it. For reference, she is a taller 2 year old, and still has plenty of room to slide. She will be able to use this for another 1-2 years. It is also really lightweight, is constantly moved indoors and out!
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: Not the most sturdy slide; however, for indoor use, I just put it on a rug and have no issues. My 1 year old loves it. We haven’t had any issues thus far except that it’s a tad narrow so when she was first learning to slide on it she leaned forward and did a flip as opposed to sliding down (no worries me and her other father were both right there to catch her). However once she got the hang of how to actually slide on her own we’ve had zero issues. Good Value buy in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: A bargain first slide
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to invest a lot in a slide because I didn’t know if my daughter would like it. The quality is better than I expected for the price I got. It definitely is NOT sturdy enough to let my 19 month old play on it without strict supervision, but I knew that going in. It’s foldable but why would you need to? I like how it’s so light that I can bring it in and out and around the house. I paired it with an inflatable pool filled with balls.
customer_reviews.author: melonbar

customer_reviews.title: Get this to keep the fun indoor at this pandemic time.
customer_reviews.text: You would not regrets getting this for your kids. Originally I did not plan to get this, until the pandemic occurs. This can keep the fun for kids indoor, without exposing to public playgrounds. The assembly is easy, just a few pieces to put together. I completed the assembly within 5 minutes. For storage, it is easy to fold up. (But we never fold it back as our kid is enjoying this everyday). The slide is light weight but still able to be sturdy in place.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This does not fold, you have to remove the ladder from the slide to store. The slide itself is pretty flimsy, but it'll do for my 15 month old. I read some reviews of children getting injured with some sharp areas on the slide, so after I set it up and before I let my daughter on it, I went over all of the edges with a very fine grit nail file. I didn't feel any severely sharp edges, but children skin is more sensitive so I thought better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Paty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Indoor Slide for Toddler!
customer_reviews.text: This is a small slide with enough thrill to delight our BUSY two year old. This slide is not for bigger kids - thus the "too small" reviews. I almost didn't buy because of the negative reviews, but then figured some people don't read descriptions and want cheap miracles in a box. I'm glad I bought this slide! Snaps together in under 60 seconds, is portable, light but not too light, and is designed so it won't tip over easily. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: A. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this slide as a gift 3 years ago, and it has been one of her favorite toys. We just bought one for my nephew's second birthday. The slide assembledls in under a minimum without instructions. We've never had an issue with the handles coming loose, and this slide has been used indoors and outdoors for years. Also, I'm sure the slide could topple if a child leans back far enough, but I haven't seen it happen yet. It should probably be used on carpet or grass just to be safe, but it hasn't been a concern for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good with our pool
customer_reviews.text: I got this to put over the edge of our 15 in our baby style inner tube pool, just to add a little excitement for my 4 yr old. He seems to like it, fits over the side with steps on the outside, I was afraid it would be too low to the ground but it works! Definitely not the most sturdy piece of equipment we’ve bought from little tykes, I guess you get what you pay for, cheapest one I could find, but it’ll do during this very long summer due to quarantine!
customer_reviews.author: Mommaof3boys

customer_reviews.title: Kids Absolutely LOVE This!
customer_reviews.text: My nieces and nephews absolutely love this little slide. It's so light that it's easy to bring in and out of the living room when they come over. My one year old nephew will go up and down this slide over and over and over again for the entire duration of a movie so it wears him out good! This was the best purchase I've made for them because it provides hours of fun for them and is so light and easy to bring in and out! Highly recommend if you're looking for something easy that will bring a lot of joy to the little one's without taking up toooooo much space.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Decent slide...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it... However, it is not as easy to fold as they make it look. Flipping it upside down, stepping on, and twisting and turning the legs to remove and break it down is a hassle (it is NOT a foldable, as claimed)...it feels as if I could break the plastic and render the slide useless...I don't even bother breaking it down unless it is an absolute must. It is sturdy enough, but something about the slide material seems like it would eventually give in, either from usage or breaking down the slide one too many times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper Since 1999

customer_reviews.title: Great for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I read all the comments and was a little worried about the sides coming off. But it is really stable! You just HAVE to make sure that you push the rails in ALL THE WAY UNTIL YOU HEAR A CLICK. Also, the stairs have sharp edges, so just sand them down a little bit. Finally, it only took my 14 month old a few tries (with my help) to figure out how to get up and down by herself. Definitely don’t leave them unattended to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mandii Mew

customer_reviews.title: missing hand rails
customer_reviews.text: got this as a christmas present for our toddler but was disappointed when we opened the package today. It was missing the 2 hand rails and it didn't even come with instruction manual on how to assemble or who to contact for missing accessories/parts. Aside from that, this slide doesn't look safe at all. It's not that sturdy. And we had to help our 2 yr-old to get up on the slide since the steps are a bit steep. Will be returning this and will invest on a high quality one
customer_reviews.author: pislang

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not the quality i remember from Little Tikes...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, but handles do require a lot of force to put in place. The plastic is VERY flimsy and bends easily. In trying to push the legs onto the slide, i was worried about bending and breaking the plastic. Stress marks were in the slide out of the box from shipping. Biggest complaint - The slide itself is not slick at all. Granted, im looking for a roller coaster for my 1 year old, but its sticky enough that instead of sliding, he tumbles face first. Even putting a blanket under him would not help him "slide". Will give it 24 hours before making a decision to return.
customer_reviews.author: Jamee Randall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and SAFE if you follow directions
customer_reviews.text: I was at first skeptical due to the one star reviews claiming its danger, but based on another's review about how you have to lock the parts in thoroughly to ensure safety, I decided to buy it (can't beat the price) and see for my self. I'm glad I did because I made extra sure the parts were inserted thoroughly without any space and sure enough, it works beautifully! My two year old loves it and it is completely safe with all the rough play. I still recommend parents to keep a watchful eye because the slide itself is a bit high for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: piccadilly

customer_reviews.title: Great little slide
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why it was asked how easy it is to fold. I don’t see any way it can fold, so I think that must be a mistake. Anyway, this is a great little slide. Light, so my kids can move it around on their own. It’s been great to have inside during winter, and it’ll be perfect to take outside in summer. The only reason I took one star off is because of the colors. I really wish more companies would choose neutral colors, or at least provide a neutral option. I obviously knew the colors going into it, but all the options I saw were obnoxious colors, so I sucked it up and got it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie & Ashley

customer_reviews.title: My 18 mo old spends hours on this!  Best purchase ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gift I’ve ever gotten my son. He is on the heavier side (101% for weight) but this slide is perfect. It’s strudy and strong and I don’t worry one bit about him on it. It’s the perfect size for him to have some fun and not be too high that it might be dangerous. He can spend hours playing with this and I love that I can use it inside and outside! I haven’t folded it up because honestly with the way it’s put together I don’t think it would fold without taking it apart. But I don’t mind that and I still think it’s worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: pcdehe

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best $30 purchase I made all year. My kids are 3 and 1 and my one year old loves this. And because he plays with it so much hugs older sister wants to play with it all the time too. It's definitely worth having it around for a rainy day to entertain the kids inside, and can also be great fun outside. I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Note, with a fold away ball pit/tunnel set and some balls you can make a very entertaining indoor playground for less than $100.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Nice little slide
customer_reviews.text: From all the reviews I had read I was worried this slide would be a cheap piece of junk. However, I was happy to find that it's a nice sturdy little slide and my two year old loves it. Regardless of what I had read, I didn't find any sharp pieces and the installation was straightforward and very easy. Once it was put together it didn't wobble or tip, and it's been used both inside and outside extensively. I've never tried to fold it up, but that seems like more of a hassle than it's worth. All in all, very happy with the slide.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazingMrsA

customer_reviews.title: Toddler's Dream Machine ! !
customer_reviews.text: We have a toddler in the house.. it's a Boy! :-) Everything slides down that slide.. toys, stuffed animals, cars, trucks, water bottles.. and of course the boy! He was leary at first climbing the ladder .. but after some practice he's a balancing champ, and loves the advantage of being up high .. he sits there being part of the adult conversation. Honestly, of all the toys.. this Slide and the Porch Swing are the main attractions. Don't hesitate.. you'll love this slide.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hartney

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: This is horrendous. Don’t buy it, no matter how heavily discounted the sales price makes it. I got it under $30 and figured how hard could it be. Well the reviews are correct. Something with four pieces shouldn’t be this hard to put together. Pieces kept bending and breaking when I tried to put it together. I’ve broken a handle simply by following the directions and reviews that say to snap it in hard. It’s a piece of junk and $28 was too much. I am so angry at this low quality little tikes product.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lightweight plastic.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same quality as used to be included with past versions of the Little Tikes slide. The plastic is so thin and cheaply made that my two-year-old (who is in the fiftieth percentile, no less), causes the front of the slide to move and shake just by ascending the steps of the slide. It hasn't yet reared back, but it's certainly not steady. I would not recommend this to other consumers. Little Tikes has gone down tremendously in quality. However, as this what what was asked for my child desired for Christmas, it's not getting returned. It's a slide my child can utilize indoors, so it gets two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Simple, affordable and lots of fun for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been enjoying this slide a lot. I got it for her when she was 16 months old because she was reluctant to go on slides in playgroups/daycare/playgrounds, especially when she had to share with other kids. I could tell that she wanted to go, she was interested but seemed overwhelmed. When she got this one at home all for herself, there was no stopping her. She'd climb on it a hundred times a day. 2 weeks later she went on any slide anywhere and was first in line to slide down. After 2 months with this slide she now goes on big kids slides at playgrounds all by herself and loves sliding down.
customer_reviews.author: Agata Bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: Best. Investment. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Are you, like us, stuck at home with a wiggly toddler who can't go to the park because there's a pandemic? BUY THIS SLIDE. I shopped and shopped, almost spent over $200 on a super-fancy, wooden, made-in-Germany slide that would have taken up twice as much space, but I'm so glad I got this cheapo one because my son LOVES it. He's 20-months, weighs 32 lbs, and just wants to move constantly. We put this in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: J. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Sorta good sorta bad.
customer_reviews.text: Update: The damaged handle no longer stays in at all after just one day leaving just one. My kid seems to be fine holding on to the red plastic of the slide but it is still disappointing. Lowering review to 2 stars. You get what you pay for I suppose. Like many have mentioned, the handles are hit or miss. One snapped into place just fine and feels sturdy. The second looks like it has bent plastic and just won't snap into place. Not sure what to do about the single bad handle.
customer_reviews.author: Ribble382

customer_reviews.title: (These were great on the first one and defective/pop out and become ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 1 star for several reasons: 1. The specifications say that you can take it apart for storage. NOT TRUE! The plastic is too thin to pull it apart, and it tears. (Even on the second one we received after returning the first one.) 2. The handles at the top that help a toddler pull him/herself up onto the slide won't stay in place. (These were great on the first one and defective/pop out and become a pinching hazard on the second one.) My little boy LOVES this slide and I'm so disappointed this replacement we are stuck with won't last long and has no handles.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Get this!!
customer_reviews.text: We got it for $29.99 in November and it has been a great slide!! The kids have used it A LOT and it doesn't show any wear yet. It was 4 easy pieces to assemble (took 5 minutes, if that). It's a good height to wear the kids get an actual fast slide down out of it (not anything like those little tikes "slides"). It seems to be made of good, sturdy material. I think it will last a good, long time. Sooo happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Dominique Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Small, Rough edges BUT fun
customer_reviews.text: So I disregarded the reviews about the rough top edge on the ladder. Took two mins to assemble. My daughter had one scratch within 5mins if using it. I resolve the problem by using extra thick furniture edge protector. My kid is petite so this slide is a little small but lots of fun. With covid pools are opening up but I am not brave enough to take her, so for now this will do to cool off Tx summer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Maggs

customer_reviews.title: careful of sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my kids. At start they did have fun with it until one day my daughter got hurt on her little palm. Some small bloody scratches. We found the edges of the stairs's back ( not the side for kids to step on but the other side facing downward to the ground) are sharp and absolutely will hurt kids if they grab this part of slide. We then jumped on Amazon and sadly found some reviews pointing it out as well. Now we already use the sand paper to file the edges smooth. I would wish the maker can improve it. Dont want any kid to get hurt again!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Not the Quality I expected from a Little Tikes product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a surprise for my 18 month old grandsons. My Two children had a small Little Tikes slide when they were little, so they enjoyed it and I thought my grandson would too. This slide stands a little taller than the vintage slide we had. This however is not solid like they're older version. This one is molded in plastic, but is easily tipped over and lightweight. Very disappointed with how flimsy it is. When he climbs the steps it is so lightweight that the bottom of the slide comes up off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Great little slide for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an indoor slide for my little girl, but could absolutely be used as an outdoor slide as well. It’s a bit lightweight, but as long as children beyond the weight limit (60 lbs) aren’t using it, it will hold up just fine. It was incredibly easy to assemble. From opening the box to this slide being ready to use took roughly 5 minutes and no tools. My little girl loves it, so I’m chalking this one up as a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dickers

customer_reviews.title: Kiddo loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kid (2) absolutely loves this. I just have it sitting in our living room and she goes down the slide constantly. It is tall enough to be fun for her but not freak me out when she is doing it by herself. It is light weight to the point that my kid can sorta move it around but stable enough that it isn't tipping over. It did have some sharp edges but a little sand paper and 2 minutes of knocking down the edges did the trick. The price is on point for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Great slide for kids!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our granddaughter because she is infatuated with slides. She's almost two and this thing is perfect for her both indoors and out. The only thing I would improve on this slide would be to make the handles at the top taller. It would make it easier for the kids to step up onto the sliding surface and provide a little more security at the top. Otherwise this is a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love this slide!
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of our sons favorite toys. He got it when he was 21 months. It is a great indoor slide. The only con is that there’s a triangle underneath poking out. I’m assuming that’s for folding up, but it seems like someone could bump their head on it if crawling under the slide. We haven’t run into that problem yet though. Great value for your money. Lots and lot of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Amy-n-Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Lightweight, but added weight and it's fine!
customer_reviews.text: The toddler loves it! I read the concerns about how light it was and how it tips when climbing up so I taped some cardboard at the end and slid in a pack of batteries to add weight. My 2 year old hasn't tipped it yet and he's been playing on it for 25 minutes straight. It does seem flimsy, bit for $35 I'm good with it. Toddler is 28 lbs and the slide isn't having any issues supporting him.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Of Course this Slide is an Essential Part of a child's development
customer_reviews.text: How modern we have become! My five children had a "wooden" slide that stayed indoors. This Little Tikes slide of a high=grade plastic for indoor and outdoor play. It is easily assembled and cleaning is a breeze with a hose!! It will become part of the triplets outdoor play world for the summer and move indoors for next fall and winter. Thanks to Little Tikes or their clever use of design and color and ease of use!
customer_reviews.author: Ann R Ford

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fun for 13 month old!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for about a month and my now 14 month old LOVES this slide! It took her a few days to master it and she plays with it all the time. She is able to climb up the stairs independently, sit and slide down without a problem. The handles go a specific way and click in so you know they are in well. I have not tried folding it, as its comstantly in use so I can’t review that piece. She slides down it, slides her toys down it, pushes the cat down it. It is a little flimsy but I only paid a little over twenty dollars so it’s well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Missah78

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fold. Too lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I choose this one because it folds and it’s Little Tikes. Space is at a premium and I always bought Little Tikes when my kids were small. It doesn’t fold as far as we can tell. It’s very lightweight, so a toddler can easily tip it. Even if the kid’s balance is gone, you have to hold the slide so that it won’t tip over. In fact it’s so light that my one year old granddaughter can lift it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa DeChiara

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 year old twins’ FAVORITE
customer_reviews.text: We. Love. This. Product. My parents bought it for my toddlers for Christmas and entertains them for about an hour at a time! It’s incredibly easy to assemble. It’s just 2 pieces that fold and collapses pretty well. (In fact, we folded and loaded it into my husbands truck to take cross-country when we went to visit in laws.) My kids like climbing so the little steps are fun, and, of course, the sliding itself is entertaining. They slide toys down it as well and giggle. Overall, probably the best toy we have.
customer_reviews.author: meagan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Toddler!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble; three attachments, click click click, DONE! My toddler is 16 months and 29 inches tall. This slide is the perfect height for her to step up while reaching the rails. There is a nice landing transition at the bottom of the slide. Within minutes our babe was using the slide independently. It's light enough to carry in and out of the house. She goes back to the slide all day - using it for herself and her toys. For SAFETY reasons, our toddler absolutely MUST be wearing socks. Bare skin on contact with the plastic causes enough friction to completely stop forward motion mid-slide; ending with a head-over-feet tumble down the slide >>> crying toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Robin G

customer_reviews.title: Makes staying inside fun! But works outside too!
customer_reviews.text: This slide is fantastic! My 18 month old nephew loves this thing. This thing is going to be a lifesaver this winter. I was concerned because some reviews said that the blue handles on top would not click in place. I had to push harder than I expected to get it clicked in, but when you hear the click you will know it! Just keep pushing! It was a pain to put together. But it was just the issue of trying to wrestle everything into place. It did not take more than 7 minutes from box to sliding. He has been playing on this thing daily and we have not had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: KimMichelle

customer_reviews.title: Side rails/handles kept popping out...UPDATE POSTED
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it could be a great toddler slide, but the blue side handles are not properly fitting inside the slots; keeps popping out. I've decided to keep it and use a bonding glue for the side handles. Hope this works. Update: Something told me to hold off on the bonding glue; instead I kept trying to get the side rails/handles to fit. Well, after days of squeezing, straining and adjusting, the side handles are now fitting inside the slots without popping out. I guess the slots needed to be loosened; now giving it 3.5-4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Monae

customer_reviews.title: Misleading - Not foldable
customer_reviews.text: Another quarantine toy purchase for our baby! I wanted something that you could easily store away but this is not fold-able. You have to take it apart to fold it down, which defeats the purpose. Still, it's kept her entertained enough and is quite sturdy even though it is an eye sore for the living room. Then again no one is visiting these days so it doesn't matter! Very easy to clean/wipe down
customer_reviews.author: A. Le

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit more for a better slide
customer_reviews.text: This slide sucks. It is made of very flimsy material and its very hard to slide down for my 1 year old because she sticks to the slide rather than glide down it. Doesn’t matter what type of clothes she wears and wearing socks doesn’t help the situation as one reviewer mentioned about this slide. Buy a better slide. I just purchased one for $120 but its well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Iman N

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: People are kinda stupid (lol) the arms go in perfectly you just have to push ... like ... a little more elbow grease than just placing it in (haha). My niece turned one and was almost doing the stairs on her own and by 14 months she can do them on her own and she's obsessed. It's a good angle so they actually get a little speed but obviously so short that you don't worry about too much speed. All in all the perfect kiddie slide!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toddlers busy! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 18 month old grandson, he lovesss it! If you buy it, keep an eye on your child, my grandson discovered that he can climb up the slide part of he’s barefooted! He also likes to stand up on the top. Little daredevil! He plays on it for hours and will use it as a ramp for his cars and sticks too. Well worth the money. It is a wide base to keep from tipping over. Light weight And folds easily so you can carry it and store it away in a closet.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic slide!
customer_reviews.text: Great for our 2 year old. Very sturdy! Handles at the top are perfect addition to help him stay stable while transitioning from stairs to top of slide. Handles do have to snap in place completely in order to not come out as other reviewers have noted. I was worried by some of the descriptions that the slide is too small - not so! It's 27+ inches tall which is excellent for our larger little boy (36" tall & 34 lbs). He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: TeacherWife

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my child to use for getting into an inflatable pool. It was easy to assemble and the color is nice. However, it's not the quality I expected from little tikes. It's a little wobbly at times and my child is a small six year old. The price is good, but I have other little tikes products that have lasted for decades and I doubt that will be the case with this slide.
customer_reviews.author: Celestino J Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, tips easily with older kids. Doesn't fold up with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's a cheap slide that's relatively tall and our toddler finds it to be great fun. Shipped quickly from Amazon despite the size. Cons: It's flimsy. Our son is almost three and of average weight but often almost tips the slide while playing on it and it moves around too much on the floor and creates a dangerous situation. He can certainly move it around on purpose without trouble. The slide does not fold up easily. Requires some real force and effort, so certainly don't get this with the intent of folding an unfolding any more often than seasonally.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: My nephew loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday present for my nephew and just saw him on it the other day. His smile was huge. It looks a little "cheap" at first, considering what I was expecting. When I was little, mine was a lot thicker than this one, but you can tell it's sturdy. For the price, if it does look a little "cheap", it's to be expected, but that doesn't mean it's not a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean S.

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice if it was a bit more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year olds LOVE this slide. They also love to tip it over and sit on it while it's upside down. Given the intended age range for this toy, and how kids so young are prone to be so rough on their toys, it would be nice if the slide was made from a slightly sturdier plastic. While it has held up very well over the last couple of months, I can only imagine that as my kids continue to grow, the slide will not last as long as it is intended to.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Your son first learner indoor slide best suited for winter
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to make activity room for our son . Slide was one of many item we bought to make the area fun for him. For first one month he was least bother and was more focused on trampling, swing and ball pit. But now as he learn to climb. Swing took second spot. My only complain is with design. As it lack any support loop on top after kid get to last step and try to sit before slide. Side supoort bar need modifition in newer model to provide more support to kid sitting over before slide
customer_reviews.author: Kunal

customer_reviews.title: Once we figured it out, it was great!
customer_reviews.text: The two handles at the top of the slides wouldn't snap in initially. Was VERY difficult to put together. My husband was a little stumped too as to why the pegs and holes wouldn’t hold. Once we figured it out and got it locked into place, it worked great! My 2 year old has been using this for the last year and loves it! :) the plastic is a shiny surface, so his little legs were bare when wearing shorts, they would stick to the slide and he would either get stuck or lose momentum and fall head first down the slide so be careful that it is age appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan T Lash

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was super simple, just make sure to snap the handrails ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my toddler. We mostly use it indoors, but we also take it outside on sunny days. The slide does rise up off the floor a bit when she climbs onto the ladder, but not enough to tip it. Assembly was super simple, just make sure to snap the handrails down really hard. You'll know when they're snapped properly when you hear a noise and can't pull them back off without a lot of force.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter Loves It!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this slide for my daughter's 1st birthday and she has absolutely loves playing with it! I have to help her up the steps of course but she thinks it's so fun to slide down. A good workout for mommy & so much fun and laughter for baby. It's very sturdy and when she is old enough to climb I would feel safe with her doing it on her own as long as I was in the room or nearby. Hardly any assembly required but it was extremely easy. It took me a total of 10 minutes to put the 4 pieces together. Would highly reccomend to anyone who wants an indoor/outdoor kiddy slide for their toddler
customer_reviews.author: Erin P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice slide
customer_reviews.text: I put this slide indoors in my sons room and he loved it. Is it a good size for a toddler and I like that it can be taken apart quickly and stored away. One thing I feel needs work is the sturdiness of the flap that helps you store the ladder behind the slide, mine looks like weak now after a few uses. It still works and hasn’t broken but I do advice you treat with care
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Great slide, plastic is sharp that can injure your little one
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little slide, which we use for our ball pit. I have a 2 and 4 year old, and they love it. It was a bit of a pain to put together, but it's sturdy once you're done. However, the exposed plastic edges are sharp, especially on the stairs and bottom of the slide (like uneven, jutting, and generally not pleasant feeling on the skin). My 2 year old stumbled and hit his eyelid on the step (while climbing), requiring an ED visit for the laceration/repair.
customer_reviews.author: Jujubea

customer_reviews.title: Now the coolest family in the neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: Who would have thought that buying this slide would cause all the neighbors to want to come over to our house. We have been requested for parties and special events. Even a few local weddings asked us to come and bring our slide! We're the coolest family on the block! Not really... However my daughter loves this still, and it's been 2 years. So for anyone 3 and under, I would recommend this as it keeps the kids entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This slide is sturdy but not real heavy. My grandson loves it but at 18 months, he’s pretty strong so when climbing up the ladder, the end of the slide sometimes lifts off the ground. I haven’t tried “folding” I don’t think it actually does, have to pop the ladder part off I believe. Overall though we’re happy with the quality and price and he gets much enjoyment out of it!
customer_reviews.author: LAL

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so it shouldn't take a rocket scientrist to figure out how to put together two pieces, right? Well, we were four adults trying to figure this out for twenty minutes before one of us (a woman no surprise) ran out to the garage to get the instructions out of the discarded box. Then,.....two days later it was time to take it apart and to go home,.....same story, lol!!!! Once you do it a time or two, it's easy, just read the directions. Our 18 month old little one loves it!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: gift for 18 month old
customer_reviews.text: i never got this for my daughter b/c it seemed like something that would get old fast and take up a lot of room....but we got this for my 18mo old for xmas b/c he loves slides and its too cold out to go to park.....this thing has paid for itself in wintertime entertainment for both my 5 year old and the 18 mo old. at 3+ months it still novel for them to play on.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great slide for low price, what is not to love
customer_reviews.text: So I was a little bit sceptical when I initially got my hands on this slide, or rather various components of this slide. After putting it all together I thought it was too flimsy and it won't last more than few slides. Well I was wrong, our 2 year old loves it and our 6 year old (she is bit too big for it) also plays on it. Slide works, is not too big and not too small and seems to work great indoor and outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: Jakub Kudlacz

customer_reviews.title: Weeeeee x 10000
customer_reviews.text: She opened it up and went down about 100 times before we made her go to bed. It got kind of static-y, but if you rub a fabric softener sheet on it, that clears right up. She loves it. But don't let them stand on the ladder and lean back, it could easily flip. We'll be adding some sort of weight to the slide part to keep that from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra koelle

customer_reviews.title: Buy this slide!
customer_reviews.text: This slide is amazing. I wasn’t expecting a lot from an inexpensive slide but I was pleasantly surprised. It is sturdy and the perfect height for my almost 2 and 3 year old. They climb it and slide down on it for hours! It’s big enough for the yard but small enough to put in your living room during a quarantine. Definitely recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Garfield

customer_reviews.title: My 19 month old loves this slide. Super steady and easy to put together and take apart
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 19 month old and he is really into it. He loves going up and down the stairs and of course sliding down, over and over again! A lot of fun. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: Steady, won’t fall to the sides or move around, easy to climb up, perfect heigh for toddles. Very easy to put together and take apart, perfect size to keep indoors. Cons: wish the sides were a big higher for safety reasons. Overall, my son really enjoys this slide. He’s the perfect size and weight for it (30 pounds) and is able to safely go up and down without any help thanks to the safe stairs design.
customer_reviews.author: Thais cypreste

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an early Toddler
customer_reviews.text: My little grandson has loved this slide. It's taller than some, but not so much that he feels unsafe climbing up it. It's a cheaper alternative while they are still small. Useful and gives them something to play with and have fun all while feeling safe. It's best to keep out of the sun, because it will fade.
customer_reviews.author: Mamanita

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. My pretty good size 3.5 year old loves it. My older kids could use it as well but I wouldn't really say for a kid past six. Sturdy, easy to assemble, good for indoor or outdoor. The box it came in was super light weight. Assembly was straight forward, I totally didn't read the directions, and took less than a minute. Overall happy with my purchase. Will recommend to people with kids similar in age.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Wessner

customer_reviews.title: Handles don’t stay on well
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. I was disappointed because the two blue handles on top do not stay in. They come off when my daughter grips them. I followed the instructions carefully and tried over and over to get them to stay in, but they continue to be easily pulled off. For us, it is not too big of a deal because her daughter is old enough to climb up without really having to use the handles, but for her younger kid oh this could cause them to fall. Not sure if this is a flaw with just ours or if this is common. Otherwise, it’s a nice slide and our daughter enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S

customer_reviews.title: Toddler must have toy!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg hours of fun!! Our little guy is 17months old and someone mentioned this is great if you aren’t able to take them outside in the cold so I knew we had to have it. Literally best money spent!!! I got open box (maybe acceptable which was my bad) and he loves it so much I wish I’d just spent the extra to get new. The item was so beat up. But he’s still happy so that’s great 🙌🏻 And hours of an entertained kid whose burning all his energy before bed time also makes for a happy mom lol.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our little girl during quarantine since we couldn't hit the park anymore. It was a great addition to her water table and trampoline. Very sturdy, we left it out and has not been damaged with any of the wind or rain. it is small, its perfect for a toddler. My daughter is a tall three year old now, so it looks like she is starting to outgrow it.
customer_reviews.author: Gavixo

customer_reviews.title: I can't get it to fold.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how the heck you could fold this. I tried and tried but it just won't snap apart without looking like it is going to snap itself into pieces. So we just put it in the garage. Good for outside and inside. We just move it to where it needs to be. While I doubt this is going to be sturdy for bigger kids for my toddler it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Auburn

customer_reviews.title: Cute slide, but not slipery
customer_reviews.text: This slide arrived in 2 days, and looks exactly as pictured. Very easy to assemble. Pretty sturdy. Only drawback is that it is not slippery. Even with my child in full length leggings, she could not slide down easily. I've heard if you rub wax paper on plastic slides it will make them more slippery. I'm going to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Anita J. Cronk

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Best $30 ever spent! Super easy to assemble. You only have to snap 4 things in its place. My 16 month old couldn’t even wait until I get this up to her room. It’s a perfect size for her. She loves this slide so much! You know with this age, they like to climb on things and the stairs behind this is just perfect for that too! It’s like a 2 toy in 1!
customer_reviews.author: Xutzen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but plastic seems thin
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this. The plastic seems thin though and it is not easy to fold but for the price it is worth it. I have a 7 year old and 22 month old and they both love it. I also have a third thats only 4 months old so I can see we will use this for years I just hope the plastic holds up. So far no issue but idk how long that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves this slide because of his innate constant urge to climb. I don't love it as much, because he can easily tip it over. It needs to be weighted on the base or something. I can't walk away even a few feet while he plays on it because I don't trust it. The slide lifts off the ground when he steps on the stairs, and he only weighs 25 lbs. When he sits on the top, all he has to do is wiggle and the corners lift up off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his slide. He has recently learned to climb up on his own (16 months). Anchoring support is not included. Supervision is necessary to prevent a toddler from toppling backwards when his/her weight might elevate the slide off of the ground.
customer_reviews.author: catskinner29

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 18m old for Christmas but we have 4 kids, the oldest being 10. So obviously they have all tried the slide and to our surprise it hasn’t collapsed yet. So, I’d say it’s sturdy. Easy to assemble.. took my husband a couple minutes. Haven’t had any issues as other customers have mentioned about sharp spots but I made sure we checked over once it was together to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha M

customer_reviews.title: First one was defective; second one is bending after about a month; adequate quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: The first one that arrived had one handle that would not snap into place. The replacement fit together well, but has begun showing signs of wear (not structural—just cosmetic) after only a month of light use. That said, for this price I have no objection to that rate of failure. I'm not an engineer, but I assume there are enormous challenges getting a large piece of injection-molded plastic to meet quality control standards.
customer_reviews.author: Mike
